ABOUT

I am a PhD student since October, 2015 at CRIStAL in the beautiful city of Lille, France.

I am working under the supervision of Pierre Chainais and Nicolas Le Bihan, and I am part of the SigMA group at CRIStAL.

My PhD subject is “Statistical analysis of random vector fields: application to geometrical phase measurements in elastography”.

Previously, I was a Master of Philosophy (MPhil) student at The University of Melbourne, Australia. I worked under the supervision of Nicolas Le Bihan, Andrew Martin and Jonathan Manton on intensity reconstruction algorithms for single-particle imaging. You can my check my Master Thesis over here.
